patterns: What is RDB?
Tell me about RDB?
What does RDB do?
responses: Rwanda Development Board (RDB) is a government institution mandated to accelerate Rwandaâ€™s economic development by enabling private sector growth, offering services such as business and investment registration, visa facilitation, EIA, tax incentives management, etc., Investment Promotion, Investment Deals Negotiation, Export & SEZ Development, Tourism and Conservation, and Private Sector Skills Development.

patterns: What are the different types of industrial property rights?
Can you list the various industrial property rights?
What does industrial property rights cover?
responses: Industrial property rights are divided into patents of invention, utility model certificates, industrial designs and models, layout designs (topographies) of integrated circuits, marks, collective marks, certification marks, trade names, and geographical indications.

patterns: What is RDB's vision?
What is RDB's mission?
What is RDB's goal?
responses: RDB's vision is to be a world-class investment promotion agency that facilitates the growth of a globally competitive private sector in Rwanda. RDB's mission is to accelerate Rwanda's economic development by enabling private sector growth. RDB's goal is to attract and facilitate investment in Rwanda.

patterns: What are the different types of copyrights?
What categories of works are protected by copyrights?
Can you give me a list of copyrightable works?
Are there specific categories of works protected by copyrights?
What are the classifications of copyright works?
responses: Copyrights are divided into the following categories: Literary works, Musical works, Computer programs, Dramatic and Dramatico-musical works, Choreographic works, Audiovisual works, Works of fine art (such as drawing, painting, sculpture, lithography, tapestry), Works of architecture, Photographic works, Works of applied art, Illustrations, Maps, Plains, Sketches and 3-D works related to geography, topography, architecture or science, and Works of Rwandan folklore.

responses: Clare Akamanzi is the Chief Executive Officer of RDB.

responses: Philip Lucky is the Ag. Chief Investment Officer of RDB.

patterns: How can I contact RDB?
What is the contact information of RDB?
What is RDB's phone number?
responses: You can contact RDB at the following address: Rwanda Development Board (RDB), KG 220 St, Kigali, Gishushu | Kigali | Rwanda. P.O. Box 6239 Kigali, Rwanda. Hotline: Cell Center (Local): 1415, Cell Center (International): +250 727775170, WhatsApp: +250 788321555 (From 7AM to 11PM Kigali Time (GMT+2)). E-mail: For general enquiries: info@rdb.rw, For investment related queries: investorfeedback@rdb.rw

patterns: How to apply for a visa in Rwanda?
What is the process for obtaining a Rwandan visa?
How long does it take to get a visa in Rwanda?
Is the visa application process online?
Can I track my visa application status?
responses: It only takes three working days to get a Rwandan Visa for an online application or through a Rwandan High Commission or Consular office. A tracking number will be issued which will later on be used to obtain the visa. Please contact the nearest Rwandan Embassy/ Consular office for further details. You may also visit this link

patterns: What services does RDB offer?
What does RDB do?
What are the services offered by RDB?
responses: RDB offers the following services: Investment Promotion, Investment Deals Negotiation, Export & SEZ Development, Tourism and Conservation, and Private Sector Skills Development.

patterns: What is RDB's investment promotion strategy?
What is RDB's investment promotion strategy?
What is RDB's investment promotion strategy?
responses: RDB's investment promotion strategy is to attract and facilitate investment in Rwanda. RDB's investment promotion strategy is to attract and facilitate investment in Rwanda.

patterns: What is the RDB Internship Program?
What are the requirements for the RDB Internship Program?
How can I apply for the RDB Internship Program?
responses: The RDB Internship Program is designed to equip interns with practical skills, reinforce practical capacity, develop professionalism, positive work ethics and employability skills, and provide work experience. It is open to all Rwandan fresh graduates from HLIs, TVET (IPRCs) in Rwanda or from abroad, in need of employability skills and professional experience. To apply, applicants should fill out the online form on the RDB website or approach the RDB Internship Office or call 1415 for support. The required documents are a copy of the degree. or use this link

patterns: What is the vision of the RDB?
What is the mission of the RDB?
What are the objectives of the RDB?
responses: The vision of the RDB is to transform Rwanda into a dynamic global hub for business, investment, and innovation. The mission is to fast-track economic development in Rwanda by enabling private sector growth. The objective is to make RDB a remarkable institution.

patterns: What types of investments are available with the RDB?
What are some of the investment opportunities with the RDB?
What sectors do the RDB offer investment opportunities in?
responses: RDB offers investment opportunities in Manufacturing, Agro-Processing, Tourism, Real estate and construction, ICT, Services, Mining, Infrastructure, Tourism, Energy, Health Services, and Education.

patterns: What are the requirements for registering an NGO, Association or a Cooperative in Rwanda?

responses: They will be requested evidence of registration at Rwanda Governance Board or Rwanda Cooperatives Agency as well as Board resolution to open up a business Shareholders particulars Board members particulars Directors particulars
Defense and Investigation activities are registered upon presentation of official authorization from the National Police

patterns: What kind of events and conferences does RDB organize?
What are the topics covered in RDB's events and conferences?
What are the benefits of attending RDB's events and conferences?
responses: RDB regularly organizes events and conferences to provide a platform for businesses, investors, and entrepreneurs to network, learn about new developments, and explore investment opportunities. These events cover a wide range of topics, including economic development, investment, business growth, entrepreneurship, tourism, and skills development.

patterns: What are RDB's trade and investment missions?
What do these missions aim to achieve?
What are the benefits of participating in RDB's missions?
responses: RDB organizes trade and investment missions to connect Rwandan businesses with potential investors and partners. The aim is to showcase Rwanda's investment opportunities, promote Rwandan products and services, and facilitate business relationships.

patterns: Can I get land for my project in Rwanda?
How to obtain land for a project in Rwanda?
What are the two ways to get land for a project in Rwanda?
Can RDB help me get land for my project?
responses: Yes land can easily be obtained for projects and this is done in two ways; Privately purchasing land from the private sector or RDB can apply for public sector land on your behalf of the investor for special considerations to cabinet, should RDB deem the project to be of significant business or strategic importance.

patterns: How much does land cost in Rwanda?
Is there a fixed price for land in Rwanda?
What factors determine the cost of land in Rwanda?
responses: There is no fixed price for land in Rwanda; this entirely depends on the location and the bargaining power between the buyer and the land owner.
